com.revature.rideshare.matching.beans

Class ResponseError

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.rideshare.matching.beans.ResponseError

  • public class ResponseError
extends java.lang.Object
    The error type that is returned in conjunction with an HTTP error status. This class is meant to be very easy to use in conjunction with controller methods. For example, the code snippet below shows how one might use a ResponseError in a controller method returning a ResponseEntity: 
     
 return new ResponseError("Something went wrong.")
     .withDetails("Here's the first problem.", "And here's the second.")
     .toResponseEntity(HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST);

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResponseError

        public ResponseError(java.lang.Exception e)
        Constructs a new ResponseError from the given exception.
        Parameters:
        e - the exception from which to construct the ResponseError. The exception's message will be used as the message for the ResponseError, but the stack trace will not be included in the details (for security reasons).

      • ResponseError

        public ResponseError(java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a new ResponseError with the given message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to describe the error

    • Method Detail

      • withDetails

        public ResponseError withDetails(java.lang.String... details)
        Sets the details of this ResponseError, returning the caller object. This is a helpful wrapper for setDetails that allows for more factory-like usage.
        Parameters:
        details - the details to associate with this error. These will overwrite any existing details that were specified earlier.
        Returns:
        the caller object, to allow for method chaining

      • toResponseEntity

        public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseError> toResponseEntity(org.springframework.http.HttpStatus status)
        Wraps this ResponseError in a ResponseEntity to allow it to be returned from a controller method.
        Parameters:
        status - the status code to send with the error
        Returns:
        the wrapped ResponseError

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Returns the string message describing the error that occurred.
        Returns:
        A string describing the error.

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the string message describing the error that occurred.
        Parameters:
        message - a string describing the error.

      • getDetails

        public java.lang.String[] getDetails()
        Gets the string array of details about the error that occurred. The array might not contain any detail strings.
        Returns:
        Array of strings holding details of the error

      • setDetails

        public void setDetails(java.lang.String[] details)
        Sets the details of this ResponseError object.
        Parameters:
        details - - the details to associate with this error. These will overwrite any existing details that were specified earlier.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashcode for this Route object. This code is based on the message string and the array of details strings.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Tests for equality between this ResponseError and another object. This returns true if the provided object reference is a non-null reference to a ResponseError object, and that the message and details of this and the other ResponseErrorobjects are equal. For details this tests equality of each element. Returns false if the this and the provided object aren't equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - - An object to test for equality against
        Returns:
        True if this and obj are equal. False otherwise.

        Returns:
        A string representation of this object.
